metadata.title: CVE-2023-24329 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue in the urllib.parse component of Python before 3.11.4 allowsattackers to bypass blocklisting methods by supplying a URL that startswith blank characters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.10 - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
libpython3.10 - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
libpython3.10-minimal - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
libpython3.10-stdlib - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
libpython3.10-testsuite - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
python3.10 - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
python3.10-examples - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
python3.10-full - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
python3.10-minimal - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
python3.10-nopie - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
python3.10-venv - 3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
python3.10 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.10.6-1~22.04.2ubuntu1.1').
python3.11 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
